module.name: LCLProc
module.short: Useful lower-level helper functions and classes.

descr.p: lclproc.pas contains lower-level classes and helper routines that are useful in LCL applications. This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: TMethodList
element.short: A list for method references.

descr.p: TMethodList is an alias for the TMethodList type in the LazMethodList unit.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo
element.short: A node in TDebugLCLItems, holding information about a heap object.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.Item
element.short: The address of the item.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.IsDestroyed
element.short: True when the item has been destroyed.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.Info
element.short: A descriptive string for the item.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.CreationStack
element.short: Stack trace at creation of the object.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.DestructionStack
element.short: Stack trace at destruction of the object.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.AsString
element.short: All information about the object as a string value.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.AsString.WithStackTraces
element.short: True to include stack traces.

element.name: TDebugLCLItemInfo.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems
element.short: A list describing dynamically allocated (and destroyed) memory objects.
element.descr: The list holds descriptive information about the object, and stack traces at the time of creation and destruction.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.FItems
element.short: The list entries, organized as an AVL tree.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Sets the Name property to the value in TheName. Allocates resources for the internal TAvlTree instance used in the class.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.Create.TheName
element.short: The descriptive name of the list.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.FindInfo
element.short: Returns information about an item, optionally creating an entry if not found.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.FindInfo.Result
element.short: The item information, or Nil if none was found or created.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.FindInfo.p
element.short: The address of the item to find.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.FindInfo.CreateIfNotExists
element.short: True means create an according list entry, if none existed yet.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.IsDestroyed
element.short: True when the item has been destroyed.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.IsDestroyed.Result
element.short: True when destroyed, False when alive or not listed.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.IsDestroyed.p
element.short: The address to find.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.IsCreated
element.short: True when the item is alive.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.IsCreated.Result
element.short: True when the item is listed and has not yet been destroyed.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.IsCreated.p
element.short: The address to find.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.MarkCreated
element.short: Checked insert of an item.
element.errors: GDB exception 'RaiseDoubleCreated' when the address is already in use.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.MarkCreated.Result
element.short: The info object describing the address.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.MarkCreated.p
element.short: The address to add.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.MarkCreated.InfoText
element.short: Descriptive text about the item.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.MarkDestroyed
element.short: Checked destruction notification.

ul.li: GDB exception 'TDebugLCLItems.MarkDestroyed' when the item was not yet created.
GDB exception 'RaiseDoubleDestroyed' when the item was already destroyed.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.MarkDestroyed.p
element.short: The address to mark as destroyed.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.GetInfo
element.short: Returns textual information about an object.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.GetInfo.Result
element.short: The descriptive string.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.GetInfo.p
element.short: The address to find.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.GetInfo.WithStackTraces
element.short: True means include stack traces.

element.name: TDebugLCLItems.Name
element.short: The descriptive name of the list.

element.name: CompareDebugLCLItemInfos
element.short: Compare function for the TDebugLCLItems AVL tree.

element.name: CompareItemWithDebugLCLItemInfo
element.short: Compare function for

element.name: TStringsSortCompare
element.short: Specifies a comparison function type for string values in a TStrings instance.

descr.p: TStringsSortCompare is an Integer function type used to compare string values to determine the relative sort order. The return value indicates the relative sort order for the compared items, and normally contains a value like the one returned from CompareText. For example:

dl.dd: Item1 has a value that comes before Item2.
Item1 and Item2 have the same value.
Item1 has a value that comes after Item2.

descr.p: The address for a TStringsSortCompare type is passed as an argument to the MergeSort routine.

element.name: TStringsSortCompare.Result
element.short: Integer with the relative sort order for the compared values.

element.name: TStringsSortCompare.Item1
element.short: First string value for the comparison.

element.name: TStringsSortCompare.Item2
element.short: Second string value for the comparison.

element.name: MergeSort
element.short: Implements a merge/sort for TStrings or TFPList.

descr.p: MergeSort is an overloaded routine used to implement a comparison-based sort routine for values in List. List can be a TStrings or TFPList instance. No actions are performed in the routine when List has not been assigned (contains Nil).

The StartIndex and EndIndex arguments allow the intial and final entries in a TFPList instance to be specified. When the values are omitted, they default to the first value (position 0) and the last value (Count-1) in List.

OnCompare is the comparison routine used to detemine the order for the sorted values. It can be a TListSortCompare or TStringsSortCompare function, depending on the overloaded variant of the called routine.
MergeSort implements the J. von Nuemann divide-and-conquer algorithm, with an insertion sort used for lists with 6 or fewer elements.

element.name: MergeSort.List
element.short: The list of values to sort (overloaded type).

element.name: MergeSort.OnCompare
element.short: The sort compare function.

element.name: MergeSort.StartIndex
element.short: The initial entry in List used in the merge/sort.

element.name: MergeSort.EndIndex
element.short: The final entry in List used in the merge/sort.

element.name: KeyAndShiftStateToKeyString
element.short: Converts the specified key code and shift modifier to their representation as a String.

element.name: KeyAndShiftStateToKeyString.Result
element.short: String representation for the specified value; i. e. 'Ctrl+Home'.

element.name: KeyAndShiftStateToKeyString.Key
element.short: Key code converted in the routine.

element.name: KeyAndShiftStateToKeyString.ShiftState
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, Alt modifier converted in the routine.

element.name: KeyStringIsIrregular
element.short: Indicates if the string contains the 'Word(nn)' representation for an unknown key code.

element.name: KeyStringIsIrregular.Result
element.short: True when the string is not a named virtual key code.

element.name: KeyStringIsIrregular.s
element.short: Value examined in the method.

element.name: ShortCutToText
element.short: Returns the textual representation for a shortcut value.

element.name: ShortCutToText.Result
element.short: Localized text value for the specified shortcut.

element.name: ShortCutToTextRaw
element.short: Converts a shortcut value to its text representation without localization.

element.name: ShortCutToTextRaw.Result
element.short: Non-localized text value for the specified shortcut.

element.name: ShortCutToTextRaw.ShortCut
element.short: Shortcut value converted in the method.

element.name: TextToShortCut
element.short: Converts the textual representation for a shortcut into a shortcut value.

element.name: TextToShortCut.Result
element.short: TShortcut value for the specified text.

element.name: TextToShortCut.ShortCutText
element.short: Text converted to a shortcut value in the method.

element.name: TextToShortCutRaw
element.short: Converts the non-localized textual representation for a shortcut into a shortcut value.

element.name: GetCompleteText
element.short: Finds a string in a list, given its first few characters.

element.name: GetCompleteText.Result
element.short: The found string.

element.name: GetCompleteText.sText
element.short: The begin of the string to find.

element.name: GetCompleteText.iSelStart
element.short: The list index where the search should start.

element.name: GetCompleteText.bCaseSensitive
element.short: True means case-sensitive comparison.

element.name: GetCompleteText.bSearchAscending
element.short: True means search ascending from iSelStart.

element.name: GetCompleteText.slTextList
element.short: The list to search.

element.name: IsEditableTextKey
element.short: Indicates if the specified key code has a value allowed in an editable text string.

element.name: IsEditableTextKey.Key
element.short: The virtual key code examined in the routine.

element.name: TSendApplicationMessageFunction
element.short: Hooks used to prevent circular unit references.

element.name: SendApplicationMessageFunction
element.short: Function used to send an application mesage using the specified parameter values.

element.name: SendApplicationMessage
element.short: Sends an application mesage using the specified parameter values.

element.name: FreeThenNil
element.short: Frees the TObject instance, before setting the reference to Nil.

element.name: FreeThenNil.obj
element.short: The object reference (variable).

element.name: CallInterfaceInitializationHandlers
element.short: Calls each of the registered initialization handlers.

element.name: CallInterfaceFinalizationHandlers
element.short: Calls each of the registered finalization handlers.

element.name: OffsetRect
element.short: Increments the Top, Left and Bottom, Right rectangle coordinates by the specified amounts.

element.name: OffsetRect.Result
element.short: True when the TopLeft coordinates are all positive.

element.name: MoveRect
element.short: Moves the rectangle origin to the given coordinates.

element.name: MoveRectToFit
element.short: Adjusts an rectangle to fit entirely into another one.

element.name: MoveRectToFit.MaxRect
element.short: The bounding rectangle.

element.name: MakeMinMax
element.short: Eventually swaps the variable contents, so that i1 is not higher than i2.

element.name: MakeMinMax.i1
element.short: Receives the minimum value of both variables.

element.name: MakeMinMax.i2
element.short: Receives the maximum value of both variables.

element.name: CalculateLeftTopWidthHeight
element.short: Converts coordinates into kind of a rectangle with positive Width and Height.

element.name: DeleteAmpersands
element.short: Removes all Ampersand ('&') characters Str, and return the position for the first occurence.

descr.p: DeleteAmpersands is an Integer function used to remove all occurences of the Ampersand character in Str. The return value contains the position in Str where the first occurence of the of the character was found.
Double Ampersands (&&) are converted to a single & character in Str.
DeleteAmpersands can be used to remove the prefix used for accelerator keys in button, tool bar, and menu captions.

element.name: DeleteAmpersands.Result
element.short: Position where the first ampersand character was found.

element.name: DeleteAmpersands.Str
element.short: String with values converted in the method.

element.name: RemoveAmpersands
element.short: Removes single Ampersand characters, and returns the converted value.

descr.p: RemoveAmpersands is an overloaded function used to remove all occurences of a single Ampsersand (&) character from the specified value. It provides variants that operate on String and PChar types. The return value contains the original value after all single Ampersand characters have been removed. Double Ampersand (&&) characters are converted into a single Ampersand character.
Use DeleteAmpersands to remove Ampersand character in the original String value.

element.name: RemoveAmpersands.Result
element.short: Value after single Ampersand characters are removed.

element.name: RemoveAmpersands.ASource
element.short: String with the values examined in the routine.

element.name: RemoveAmpersands.Src
element.short: PChar value examined in the routine.

element.name: RemoveAmpersands.LineLength
element.short: Length of the value in Src.

element.name: CompareHandles
element.short: Compares two Handles, returning the relative order for the handle values.

descr.p: The return value contains the following:

dl.dd: h1 has a lower value than h2.
h1 and h2 have the same value.
h1 has a higher value than h2.

element.name: CompareHandles.Result
element.short: Relative order for the compared handle values.

element.name: CompareHandles.h1
element.short: First handle for the comparison.

element.name: CompareHandles.h2
element.short: Second handle for the comparison.

element.name: CompareRect
element.short: Indicates if the specified rectangle pointers have the same coordinate values.

element.name: CompareRect.Result
element.short: True when the top, left, bottom, and right values in each rectangle are the same.

element.name: CompareRect.R1
element.short: Pointer to the first rectangle for the comparision.

element.name: CompareRect.R2
element.short: Pointer to the second rectangle for the comparision.

element.name: ComparePoints
element.short: Compares the specified TPoint values to get their relative order.

descr.p: ComparePoints is an Integer function used to compare the coordinates in the specified TPoint instances to determine their relative order. The return value contains -1, 0, or 1 for the following conditions:

dl.dd: p1.y is smaller than p2.y, or p1.x is smaller than p2.x.
p1 and p2 have the same x and y values.
p1.y is larger than p2.y, or p1.x is larger than p2.x.

element.name: ComparePoints.Result
element.short: Relative order for the compared TPoint values.

element.name: ComparePoints.p1
element.short: First TPoint instance for the comparison.

element.name: ComparePoints.p2
element.short: Second TPoint instance for the comparison.

element.name: CompareCaret
element.short: See ComparePoints

element.name: CompareMethods
element.short: Returns true when both method references are equal.
element.version: Deprecated in LCL version 2.1. Will be removed in version 2.3.

element.name: ComparePointers
element.version: Deprecated in LCL version 2.1. Will be removed in version 2.3.

element.name: RoundToInt
element.short: Returns the rounded value as an Integer.
element.version: Deprecated in LCL version 2.1. Will be removed in version 2.3.

element.name: RoundToCardinal
element.short: Returns the rounded value as an Cardinal.
element.version: Deprecated in LCL version 2.1. Will be removed in version 2.3.

element.name: TruncToInt
element.short: Returns the truncated value as an Integer.
element.version: Deprecated in LCL version 2.1. Will be removed in version 2.3.

element.name: TruncToCardinal
element.short: Returns the rounded value as an Cardinal.
element.version: Deprecated in LCL version 2.1. Will be removed in version 2.3.

element.name: StrToDouble
element.short: Converts an numeric string into an Double value.
element.version: Deprecated in LCL version 2.1. Will be removed in version 2.3.

element.name: RaiseGDBException
element.short: Raises a catchable exception.

descr.p: Normally, GDB does not catch FPC Exception objects. This procedure raises a standard divide by zero exception which is caught by GDB.

element.name: DebugLn
element.short: Writes a number of strings (heavily overloaded) to the debug output.

element.name: DebugLn.S
element.short: A single string, or a Format string when followed by an argument list.

element.name: DebugLn.Args
element.short: Writes the formatted dump of the typed arguments.

element.name: DbgS
element.short: Formats debug output for various argument types (overloaded).

ul.li: TRect, TPoint: shows the x/y coordinates.
String, WideString: chars > #126 are translated into #nn (or #nnnn) character constants.

element.name: DbgSName
element.short: Returns the component or class name.

element.name: DbgStr
element.short: Converts control characters, or characters above #126 into #hex format.

element.name: DbgWideStr
element.short: Converts control characters, or characters above #126 into #hex format.

element.name: dbgMemRange
element.short: Provides an hex dump of a memory section.

element.name: dbgMemRange.Result
element.short: The formatted dump.

element.name: dbgMemRange.P
element.short: The start address.

element.name: dbgMemRange.Count
element.short: The number of bytes to dump.

element.name: dbgMemRange.Width
element.short: The number of bytes per line, zero for no line breaks.

element.name: dbgMemStream
element.short: Provides a hex dump of an memory stream.

errors.p: The dump starts at the current stream position, the position moves to the end of the dumped range.

element.name: dbgMemStream.Count
element.short: The maximum number of bytes to dump.

element.name: dbgObjMem
element.short: Provides an hex dump of an TObject.

element.name: dbghex
element.short: Provides an hex dump of an Int64 value, (sign + absolute value).

element.name: DbgSWindowPosFlags
element.short: Provides an dump of SetWindowPosition flags.

element.name: DbgsVKCode
element.short: Converts a virtual key code to its String representation.

element.name: DbgSaveData
element.short: Writes data into an file.

element.name: DbgAppendToFile
element.short: Appends a line to the given file.

element.name: DbgAppendToFileWithoutLn
element.short: Appends (preformatted) text to an file.

element.name: ClassCase
element.short: Indicates if a TClass instance is found in the specified array.

element.name: ClassCase.Result
element.short: Ordinal position in ACase where the TClass instance was found, or -1 when not found.

element.name: ClassCase.AClass
element.short: TClass instance to locate in ACase.

element.name: ClassCase.ACase
element.short: Array of TClass instances to examine in the routine.

element.name: ClassCase.ADescendant
element.short: True to consider descendants of AClass as a match in the routine.

element.name: UTF16String
element.short: Alias to the UnicodeString type.

element.name: PUTF16String
element.short: Pointer to the UTF16String type.

element.name: UTF16CharacterLength
element.short: Deprecated, see the LazUTF16 unit in the LazUtils package for replacements.

element.name: UTF16Length
element.short: Deprecated, see the LazUTF16 unit in the LazUtils package for replacements.

element.name: UTF16CharacterToUnicode
element.short: Deprecated, see the LazUTF16 unit in the LazUtils package for replacements.

element.name: UnicodeToUTF16
element.short: Deprecated, see the LazUTF16 unit in the LazUtils package for replacements.

element.name: CreateFirstIdentifier
element.short: Replaces last digits with 1.

element.name: CreateNextIdentifier
element.short: Deprecated, see the LazUTF8 unit in the LazUtils package for replacements.

element.name: IsFontNameDefault
element.short: Indicates if the specified name contains 'default'.

element.name: IsFontNameDefault.Result
element.short: True when AName contains 'default'.

element.name: IsFontNameDefault.AName
element.short: Font name examined in the routine.
